lines.text: Why is it that you never got married Freddy?
All the best girls were taken.

Listen to me, I got a check in my pocket for $200,000. I got a chance to start my life again. I don't give a shit about this town, I don't give a shit about that town and I don't give a shit about your fucking justice. Bein' right is not a bulletproof vest, Freddy.
Being right is not a bullet-proof vest, Freddy!
I can't hear you Ray.
See sheriff, I got a sticky problem. My jurisdiction ends, in a sense, at the George Washington Bridge. But half the men I watch live beyond that bridge, where no one's watching.
I'm watching.
The case is closed, finished, over! Go to lunch! Go! Hey, go to lunch. Go to lunch! The case is closed. Everybody, get the fuck outta here. Get outta here! The case is fucking closed!
Look Freddy, I say it's okay to be jealous. You save this girl's life, right? From it, from risking yourself, from saving her sorry ass, you go deaf as a result.
In one ear.
In one ear. Then you have to watch this girl you saved, this beauty queen, marries this cocksucker.
What about Babitch?
What about him? Fuck him.
What about Donlan?
Fuck him too.
What about Joey Randone?
He fell off a building. Don't you read the papers?
Listen, you deaf fuck. I offered you a chance when we could have done something, I offered you a chance to be a cop, and you blew it! You blew it.
You don't go down Broadway to get to Broadway! You zig! You zag!
I gave you a chance to be a cop and you blew it
What brings you to our fair city?
I heard there was a way of life out here. Thought I'd check it out for myself.
What are we, like the Amish now?
I look at this town, and I don't like what I see.
Shut the fuck up, would ya, please? Sh - fuck!
Don't shut me out, Ray! You found us a sweet little town. You got us the low interest, and I'm grateful. But don't forget who it was that you came to two years ago to cover your ass.
Get him outta here Freddy.
Come on.
[as he tries to pull Figgs out of the bar but is pushed away]
It's not my fault that you can't look at him! You sit in this chair with your back to 'im. You want it to go away, but I'm still here. In for a penny, in for a pound. Don't shut me out, Ray.
I don't know about Ray, but not everyone in Garrison is a murderer.
No, they just keep their eyes closed and their mouths shut, just like me.
Can't do anything now! Hands are tied now!
That cupcake makes a mess and we got a case again.
What the fuck, Ray? You said PDA was gonna set this guy up, with a new life and everything.
You think I'm all that, huh, Joey?
See officer, in Garrison, when the car you're gonna tag has got a PDA sticker, I'd advise you to think to yourself, "Hey, that's one of the good guys. I think I'll go catch me a bad guy."
If we didn't pull over P.D., there wouldn't be any violations in this town.
What you've got here, sheriff, is a town that scares the shit outta certain people.
How do you think this makes me look.
Go home and don't think so much.
You're just a child, Freddie.
Are you on the job?
No honey were commin' from Forest Hills. I'm John MacEnroe, that's Jimmy Conners.
[first lines]

[narrating]
Every precinct has its cop bar - a private club - all blue. For the 3-7 it was the Four Aces, just across the river.
I always liked you, Murray. You just sweat too much!
You're gonna be hurtin', Freddy. You're not gonna know when, you're not gonna know where. You're gonna be hurtin'. You mark my words - I'm watchin' you!
You know the difference between men and boys? Boys bet everything on everything! Boys think every hand is a royal flush! You play cards with a man, he knows his limits.
You people are all the same.
pinball people and video game people. You, Freddy, you're pinball people.
Pretty boy Joey bettin' against the Bulls. What are you, some kind of high roller?
Fuck you Figgs, I had twelve points.
Against the five-time NBA champs? What kind of a bet is that? You know you night guys watch too much Oprah when you should be catching z's.
Uh-huh, Figgs. At least I'm not the one sniffin' my money away.
That was your inner child making a bet there, Joey. Little boy Joey with the Mets poster taped above his bed.
Tell you what, Figgs. Why don't you come over here, unzip me, pull out my inner child and take a bite. Bite it hard and bite it thick!
Fuck you!
No, fuck you!
